manticore.data
Interface JAXBDataController

public interface JAXBDataController

Public interface for mapping and saving data using JAXB.

Method Summary
 java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String name)
          Returns the object previosuly saved with the name given.
 boolean has(java.lang.String name)
          Tells whether there is a stored object with the name given.
 java.lang.Object load(java.lang.Class[] boundClasses, java.lang.String path)
          Load an instance from the XML found in path using the boundClasses to understand all the data.
 java.lang.Object load(java.lang.Class c, java.lang.String path)
          Load an instance of the given class from the XML found in path
 void save(java.lang.Object o, java.lang.String path)
          Saves the given object as XML in the given path.
 void save(java.lang.Object o, java.lang.String path, java.lang.Class[] boundClasses)
          Load the given object as XML in the given path using the boundClasses to translate all the data.
 void set(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object o)
          Stores an object with the name given.

has

boolean has(java.lang.String name)
Tells whether there is a stored object with the name given.

Parameters:
name - Name of the object
Returns:
True if an object with that name is stored, false otherwise

save

void save(java.lang.Object o,
          java.lang.String path)
          throws javax.xml.bind.JAXBException
Saves the given object as XML in the given path.

Parameters:
o - Object to save as XML
path - Path where to save the file with the generated XML
Throws:
javax.xml.bind.JAXBException

save

void save(java.lang.Object o,
          java.lang.String path,
          java.lang.Class[] boundClasses)
          throws javax.xml.bind.JAXBException
Load the given object as XML in the given path using the boundClasses to translate all the data. This method is useful to say explicitly which classes JAXB has to take into account to save the data.

Parameters:
o - Object to save as XML
path - Path where to save the file with the generated XML
boundClasses - Classes that JAXB has to take into account
Throws:
javax.xml.bind.JAXBException

load

java.lang.Object load(java.lang.Class c,
                      java.lang.String path)
                      throws javax.xml.bind.JAXBException
Load an instance of the given class from the XML found in path

Parameters:
c - Class of the object to load
path - Path to the XML file to load
Returns:
The loaded object
Throws:
javax.xml.bind.JAXBException

load

java.lang.Object load(java.lang.Class[] boundClasses,
                      java.lang.String path)
                      throws javax.xml.bind.JAXBException
Load an instance from the XML found in path using the boundClasses to understand all the data. This method is useful to say explicitly which classes JAXB has to take into account to load the data.

Parameters:
boundClasses - Classes that JAXB has to look at
path - Path to the XML file to load
Returns:
The loaded object
Throws:
javax.xml.bind.JAXBException
